abstract.p: Dr Bob LeBow letter on Sept 10 article on high cost of medical care and providing health insurance for everyone; suggests single-payer national health insurance--in effect, Medicare for all--as way to bring affordable health care to every American

block.p: A headline asks, ''What if There Is No Cure for Health Care's Ills?'' (Week in Review, Sept. 10). But the obvious solution is the approach that almost every other industrialized country has used to attain universal coverage: single-payer national health insurance.

A headline asks, ''What if There Is No Cure for Health Care's Ills?'' (Week in Review, Sept. 10). But the obvious solution is the approach that almost every other industrialized country has used to attain universal coverage: single-payer national health insurance.

We already have rationing of health care in America. Those who can afford it, get it; those who can't, don't. We should discard two myths: that the market is the solution and that we can get to universal coverage through incremental change.

Although special interests like the insurance and pharmaceutical industries will vigorously oppose it, single-payer national health insurance -- in effect, Medicare for all -- would bring affordable health care to every American.
BOB LEBOW, M.D. Nampa, Idaho, Sept. 10, 2000
